task_summary: The robot pours liquid from a cup into a mug, demonstrating approach, alignment, pouring actuation, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A robotic arm is tasked with pouring the contents of a cup into a mug positioned on a tabletop. The robot detects the mug, moves to a position above it while holding the cup, then executes a pour by tilting the source container. After pouring, the robot retreats. The sequence prioritizes reliable pose estimation and smooth pouring motion, given workspace constraints and object geometry.
preconditions: Cup is grasped by the robot
Mug is present and visible on the table
stepwise_plan: Detect the mug on the table
Move above the mug to the correct pour position
Pour from the cup into the mug by tilting
success_criteria: Mug receives the poured contents from the cup
No major spillage around the mug
Robot returns to a safe position after pouring
failure_and_recovery: Mug not detected: retry or scan for mug
Pour misalignment: reapproach and realign, then repeat pour
Spillage detected: abort pouring and retreat
task_long_description.termination: Task ends when the robot completes the retreat following the pouring action.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Detects the mug on the tabletop.
Moves cup above the mug, preparing for pour.
Pours contents from the cup into the mug by tilting.
Moves the arm away from the mug after pouring.

recovery_strategy: Retry or scan if mug not detected
Realign and reattempt pour on misalignment
Abort and retreat on spillage or collision
assumptions: Instruction specifies only the destination ('mug') without explicit mention of the source; visual evidence infers the source is the cup (held by arm throughout).
Cup is already in the gripper at episode start (pre-grasp not shown in frames).
Pour parameters ('amount', 'pour_rate') are unspecified in both instruction and frames; set as null.
No explicit object category ports required due to clear geometry in sequence.
No evidence of error handling or retries in frames.

expected_success_criteria: Contents are poured from cup into mug with minimal spillage.
Mug is not displaced from pouring motion.
Cup is released or retracted safely post-pour.
